text: What's up outliers? Quick market update specifically on GameStop. Actually, I'm going to start doing a few videos per week covering a couple different covered strangles that I trade. And as we discussed in the introduction videos specifically for GameStop, I have an allocation of the portfolio that I'm using to trade a covered strangle in GameStop. And then I also have other ones in some leverage DTFs. I bit for Bitcoin and those will be separate videos. So the goal for today is to walk you through some updates on the position as it sets you a quick overview of what seems to be going on in GameStop because how to really good day today, especially with the rest of the market showing as much weakness as it did, GameStop is genuinely showing market strength, which is very, very cool to see. So from a quick technical overview looking at a six month daily chart, that's what's up here now. We can see that it's been just kind of running up along this trend line for a little while now. And it's progressively posting higher lows and higher highs, which obviously is associated with an uptrend. Now one thing that does stick out to me when looking at GameStop specifically is this trend line is really steep. What I do for things like this is I monitor the relationship between the trend line and the standard deviation channels or linear regression channels, whichever I happen to have up at

So I would have 300 shares against two short calls, maximum 200 short sales. And the intention is not to get assigned on those short calls. So they would be managed against the long shares via aggressive management, meaning I'm paying close attention to it. I'm not just letting it go and seeing what happens so that I don't get assigned. The risk is that I could get assigned early. That is a thing, especially if something like GameStop squeezes while I'm in doing this. And I have short calls. There is absolutely a potential for somebody that's being squeezed that has those calls to exercise them early. That's the risk that I run and that's why I'm not trading it at a 1-1 ratio. I don't want to unwind the whole position. I don't even want to unwind 2-3. But I want to make sure that I'm trading in and out of this thing so that we can generate as much money as we can based on where GameStop started the year, which I'm going to track right here. And we will see how we are able to progress. So far, the trade
